result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony C Plemens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision to the property owner First.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  
Costs of $243.00 in Count #2 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision on Count #1.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with any of the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint (no direct contact, social media contact or third party contact).
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packed, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol( i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Anthony C Plemens in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.   

Defendant pleads No Contest to both count 1 & count 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both count 1 & count 4.
Repeater enhancers are struck on both counts 1 & 4.
Counts 2 & 3 are Dismissed and Read-In.
Victim H.D. presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented statements to the court.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  5.5  Years
Initial Confinement:   2.5  Years
Extended Supervision:  3   Years
145 Days Credit
Concurrent to:  Revocation sentence he is currently serving.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any of the victims listed in the criminal complaint (no direct contact, social media contact or third party contact)
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250
D.V. Surcharge:  $100
Restitution:  $1,080 (to the property owner - to be paid first)
To be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Count 4:
Concurrent to count 1 and Revocation sentence he is currently serving.
 9   Months in the Waukesha County Jail

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a condition of extended on count 1.
